title: Levi Co. "handtooled" font
content:
There's also Century Handtooled, which is closer, but not an exact match.   
   
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/century-handtooled/?PREFS\_SET%5BRenderSize%5D=60&PREFS\_SET%5BRenderString%5D=LEVI+CO](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516225011/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/century-handtooled/?PREFS_SET%5BRenderSize%5D=60&PREFS_SET%5BRenderString%5D=LEVI+CO).
author: marcox

comments.content: My guess is that this is a custom design. It looks like whoever did it started from the basic letterforms of Times Roman, made it a bit heavier, changed the period to a diamond, and added the hilites.

The Co looks like it might be an actual font, although I can't place it, because the highlights are consistent and well drawn. Levi looks like someone added the highlights (badly) in Illustrator. They don't match at all.
